ServerError/9431┃Unable to disolve team. (9431)
ServerError/9432┃Unable to kick team member. Please try again. (9432)
ServerError/9433┃Unable to leave the team. Please try again. (9433)
ServerError/9434┃Unable to create and register team.\nTeam Registration Requirements: Account level 30 or higher, Ranked Gold tier or higher.
ServerError/9435┃Unable to participate in Union Match. (9435)
ServerError/9436┃Team must have at least 3 members. (9436)
ServerError/9437┃Unable to create team at this time. (9437)
ServerError/9438┃Team name already exists. (9438)
ServerError/9439┃Unable to register team. 3 members are already part of another team. (9439)
ServerError/9440┃Unable to kick members at this time. (9440)
ServerError/9441┃Team includes a member with a lower account level. (9441)
ServerError/9442┃Unable to cancel team creation. Please try again. (9442)
ServerError/9443┃Not a team member. (9443)
ServerError/9444┃Unable to change teams. (9444)
ServerError/9445┃One of your team members has a suspended account. (9445)
ServerError/9446┃You can only join up to 3 teams as a team member. (9446)
ServerError/9447┃This team does not exist. (9447)
ServerError/9448┃You don’t have enough points to cover the entry cost. (9448)
ServerError/9449┃You cannot cancel the team's registration while members are still participating. (9449)
ServerError/9450┃The team is full and cannot accept more members. (9450)
ServerError/9451┃Union Circuit is available for players level 30 and above.
ServerError/9452┃Matching is not available for this team's tier. Please check the matching schedule for each tier.
ServerError/99999┃A connection has been made with an incompatible version.
ServerError/HttpException┃Error connecting to the server.
gameTip_Desc_10250_1┃Find a campfire on Lumia Island where you can make special dishes.\nAll the normal (white) materials you can find on Lumia Island turn into amazing dishes when cooked over a campfire.\n\nWith a campfire, you too can become a top chef!\n\nIf a campfire is too far away to get to, why not try the Gadget - Hunter's Pot?\nHunter's Pot can be obtained by <color=#8FDBF8>hunting wild animals</color>.
게임팁 링크┃Move Link
gameTip_Title_10000_1┃Planning / Crafting Guide
gameTip_Desc_10000_1┃So you opened a box - don't know which items to grab? Pay attention to the items with <color=#8FDBF8>yellow markers</color>! Those are items you'll definitely need.\n\nUnsure which items to get in the current area? Don't worry! The <color=#8FDBF8>Crafting Guide</color> shows which items you can get!\n\nYou can craft powerful equipment by collecting all the necessary materials!
gameTip_Title_10000_2┃Planning / Crafting Guide
gameTip_Desc_10000_2┃Don't memorize — plan!\n\nPlanning is like <color=#8FDBF8>farming</color>. If you register which area you need to move to and which equipment you want, you can quickly get the materials you need without wandering around!\n\nIf making a plan is difficult, try using a shared plan. You'll be able to create your own plan the more you get used to it.\n\nMake a plan before the game starts and devise your own strategy!
gameTip_Title_10010_1┃Crafting
gameTip_Desc_10010_1┃Crafting is a must to survive! Gather your materials and make even more powerful equipment through crafting.\n\nYou can craft by pressing the craft icon shown at the bottom of the screen, but it's easier and faster to craft by pressing the <color=#8FDBF8>[Z Hotkey]</color> to <color=#8FDBF8>quick craft</color>.\n\nQuick crafting starts with the left most items, but don't worry! Your most necessary items start from the left for better accessibility.
gameTip_Title_10020_1┃Credits
gameTip_Desc_10020_1┃On Lumia Island, you can earn credits, which act as in-game currency, through a multitude of actions.\nSo how do you get credits?\n- First: you get credits for free at <color=#8FDBF8>certain time periods</color> of the game!\n- Second: Hunting <color=#8FDBF8>Wild Animals</color>.\n- Third: Eliminating other <color=#8FDBF8>test subjects</color>.\n\nWhat do you do when you have a bunch of credits? Check the next page to find out!
gameTip_Title_10020_2┃Remote Drones
gameTip_Desc_10020_2┃By right-clicking on an item on your VPad anytime, anywhere, you can use a remote drone to get the item you want.\n\nKeep in mind that you need <color=#8FDBF8>Credits</color> to use the remote drone. 
gameTip_Title_10020_3┃Kiosk
gameTip_Desc_10020_3┃Did you know that using a Kiosk makes it easier to purchase special materials with your Credits?\n\nA Kiosk is another way to get materials like Tree of Life or Meteorite! Use a Kiosk in the 4 designated areas of Lumia Island to get the special materials. It's simple!\nClick the Kiosk → Click the item you want → Wait!\n\nFair warning: Special materials aren't cheap. \n
gameTip_Title_10030_1┃Wild Animals
gameTip_Desc_10030_1┃Hunt Lumia Island's wild animals to get Credits and items.\n\nChickens, bats, bears, and wolves are just a few of the wild animals on Lumia Island. If you hunt them, you'll get Credits, materials, and food to eat.\n\nMake sure you craft and level up your weapons before hunting! It'll be a tough fight if you're at a lower level.
gameTip_Title_10031_1┃Wild Animals - Mutants
gameTip_Desc_10031_1┃Have you noticed that some of Lumia Island's Wild Animals look a bit different?\n\nThese enhanced Wild Animals are called "mutants." Mutants are much stronger than regular Wild Animals, and you can get better rewards and more Credits for killing them.\n\nMutants appear after a certain number of kills of each Wild Animal, or they appear later in game in powerful packs that roam with regular Wild Animals.\n\n
gameTip_Title_10032_1┃Boss Monsters
gameTip_Desc_10032_1┃Do you know the powerful boss monsters who appear on Lumia Island: Wickeline, Alpha, and Omega?\n\nThey appear at different times, but you can check the times by clicking the <color=#8FDBF8>[TAB Hotkey]</color> and where they'll appear by clicking the <color=#8FDBF8>[M Hotkey]</color>. You can also see the location on the Minimap!\n\nYou get special rewards (buffs, special materials, etc.) if you take out the boss monsters. Be warned though: if you're not prepared, you can be defeated or ambushed by other Test Subjects. Always be on your guard when taking on a boss monster!
gameTip_Title_10040_1┃Special Materials
gameTip_Desc_10040_1┃Special materials are needed to make powerful items!\n\nAs the materials are special, the way to get them is just as special.\n\nYou can get these materials at certains times in areas of the map, such as the Tree of Life or Meteorite, or can be purchased from Kiosks with Credits, hunting boss monsters, or by opening Air Supply Boxes.
gameTip_Title_10050_1┃Match Status Info
gameTip_Desc_10050_1┃Press the [TAB Hotkey] to see various game status information!\n\n① Participating test subject information\n② Object time information \n③ Map and farming routes\n\nGain quick, helpful information to lead yourself to victory!\n\n\n
gameTip_Title_10060_1┃Information Overlay
gameTip_Desc_10060_1┃Use the Information Overlay [ALT] to quickly check information on a variety of objects and Wild Animals around Lumia Island.\n\nYou can toggle the Information Overlay by pressing the <color=#8FDBF8>[F8 Hotkey]</color>. The type of information being displayed can be selected in the [Settings Menu].
gameTip_Title_10070_1┃Security Console
gameTip_Desc_10070_1┃Activate the security console in each area of Lumia Island to gain important sight on the enemies' location. Use this information to gain the upper hand!\n\nBy activating a security console in an area, you'll be able to see CCTVs that shows the area around the camera. Also, activating a security console that is not occupied by an ally will grant you a small amount of Credits,\n\nOn the other hand, if the CCTV is moving closer to you and blinking red, that means someone is watching you instead! Run for it!
gameTip_Title_10071_1┃Hyperloop & VLS
gameTip_Desc_10071_1┃Big changes are coming to the Hyperloop system.\nStarting on Day 3, the new VLS transportation devices will be available in Safe Zones, while Hyperloops will be dynamically activated in Restricted Areas.\nUnlike Hyperloops, the VLS allows movement by "gliding" within a certain radius.
gameTip_Title_10071_2┃Hyperloop
gameTip_Desc_10071_2┃Did someone say, FAST TRAVEL?\n\nIt may look like a broken down phone booth, but this booth allows you to travel anywhere on Lumia Island thanks to Hyperloop technology. You can also tap on a <color=#8FDBF8>teammate's picture</color> to be teleported directly to them!\n\n*Hyperloop Usage Precautions*\nYou may accidentally run into enemies after teleporting. Be careful!
gameTip_Title_10071_3┃VLS
gameTip_Desc_10071_3┃Unlike Hyperloops, the VLS isn't designed for long-distance travel but enables synchronized gliding with allies.\nWhile you're gliding, the ground becomes visible below a certain altitude, making it excellent for scouting.\nLanding after gliding triggers a brief area-wide stun, making it useful for initiating.\nOnly the Host can control the gliding, with allies relying on the Host for synchronized movement. At a certain altitude, allies can break away from the Host and move freely.
gameTip_Title_10072_1┃Launch Pad
gameTip_Desc_10072_1┃The Launch Pad allows you to easily and quickly move to distant areas!\nThey can be crucial in confrontations with enemies, so practice using them strategically!
gameTip_Title_10090_1┃Quick Communication
gameTip_Desc_10090_1┃You can ping anyone by clicking ALT + the left mouse button.\n\nEven if there's no time to chat, use the ping function to communicate in a variety of ways. Send an exclamation point to allies to alert them to "danger ahead!"\n\nIf you need a bit more in-depth communication, click CTRL and drag the left mouse button for the <color=#8FDBF8>quick chatting function</color>. Click CTRL + the left mouse button to <color=#8FDBF8>set goals with your team</color>.
gameTip_Title_10100_1┃Detonation Timer
gameTip_Desc_10100_1┃If you're in a Restricted Area marked in red, you better get out of there, stat! If not, you'll die as soon as the detonation timer goes off.\n\nDetonation timers are placed in Restricted Areas and activate with terrifying effects. When the timer reaches 0, you can kiss your life goodbye.\n\nYou can restore the detonation timer by killing other test subjects, but it's better for you not to be there at all.\n\n"Soon the Test Subject will explode!"
gameTip_Title_10110_1┃Temporary Safe Zone
gameTip_Desc_10110_1┃When the last safe zone is designated as a Restricted Area, two temporary safe zones are created if <color=#8FDBF8>3 or more survivors</color> are still alive.\n\nThe detonation timer won't tick down if your team is inside the safe zone. On the other hand, if 2 or more teams are in the temporary safe zone, or if they leave the temporary safe zone, the detonation timer begins ticking again.\n\nIt's a piece of cake. Keep your team in the temporary safe zone, and drive out any enemies to stay alive!
gameTip_Title_10120_1┃Final Safe Zone
gameTip_Desc_10120_1┃The final safe zone is a place to determine the ultimate winner.\n\nThe final safe zone is placed around the security console in the last Restricted Area. As the detonation timer works everywhere except the safe zone, you have to fight and win.\n\nIf the final safe zone is activated and there is no winner after a certain amount of time, all safe zones will be discarded and the detonation timer begins ticking for everyone. This is your time to defeat the enemy and claim first place!
gameTip_Title_10130_1┃Auto Revive
gameTip_Desc_10130_1┃Died? Don't give up just yet!\n\nIf your teammates are still alive, you will auto-revive until Night 2. An enemy guarding your dead body? No problem - you can choose the spot to respawn. A place close to your team should be safe... right?
gameTip_Title_10140_1┃Downed / Slain
gameTip_Desc_10140_1┃Test subjects on Lumia Island become downed when they are first slain. When down, you can only move or discard items, and your detonation timer and HP drop even if you stand still.\n\nIf you die again while down, your dead body will be left behind. You can grab items left from dead test subjects. If you hunt a test subject that has a Legendary item, you can earn a large amount of Credits through bounty items.
gameTip_Title_10140_2┃Downed Skill
gameTip_Desc_10140_2┃Don't give up when you're downed!\nThere are some special skills that can only be used while downed!\n\nThere are a total of 3 Downed Skills:\n1. <color=#8FDBF8>Obstinacy</color>, which temporarily increases movement speed while downed. \n2. <color=#8FDBF8>Fission Blast</color>, which makes test subjects to self-destruct.\n3. <color=#8FDBF8>AED</color>, which allows test subjects to self-revive after a certain amount of time.\n\nCreate a more diverse gameplay by strategically using Downed Skills!
gameTip_Title_10150_1┃Air Supply Box
gameTip_Desc_10150_1┃Are you out of food? Or maybe you didn't craft the equipment you need? If so, look for the Air Supply Box on the map!\n\nYou can get food from a food box, more powerful materials from an Air Supply Box, and Legendary equiment in a legendary-level box. Open up the box and hope what you need is inside!\n\nDon't miss out when warnings of where and when the reward boxes will drop appear on the minimap.
gameTip_Title_10160_1┃Level / Skill
gameTip_Desc_10160_1┃Use the points you gain to level up and use stronger skills!\n\nWhen you obtain a certain level of mastery, the test subject's "level" increases. As level goes up, so do stats. Gain skill points to use even stronger skills\n\nLevel up and become as strong as you can!
gameTip_Title_10170_1┃Augments
gameTip_Desc_10170_1┃You can add new skills and buffs to your test subjects by selecting Augments.\n\nAugments allow more variety and options. For example, using Fortification Augments will increase Defense and reduce Damage. If you use Support Augments, you may be able to help your teammates and lead them to victory!\n\nDon't know which Augments are better suited for your test subjects? Check them out in the <color=#8FDBF8>[Loadout → Augments Menu]</color>!
gameTip_Title_10200_1┃Battle Zone
gameTip_Desc_10200_1┃Battle Zones are special areas purposefully made for battle. Their purpose is collecting data on test subjects that show up in these extreme environments.\n\nEach Battle Zone has a special environment. Some can increase movement speed, some increase Omnisyphon, and others recharge your shield.\n\nThe winner will receive <color=#8FDBF8>special rewards</color> that can only be found in the Battle Zone. 
gameTip_Title_10200_2┃Battle Zone Flow
gameTip_Desc_10200_2┃All predicted locations of Day 2 Restricted Areas will be chosen as <color=#8FDBF8>Battle Zone locations</color>.\n\nThe location of the <color=#8FDBF8>Battle Zone</color> will be designated on Night 2.\n\nThe type of Battle Zone can be checked via the Battle Zone Mark on the World Map Security Console Location.
gameTip_Title_10200_3┃How to Participate in Battle Zones
gameTip_Desc_10200_3┃When the Battle Zone begins, the test subjects in the area become Battle Zone participants.\n\nIf participants die in the Battle Zone, they will be revived after a short period of time.\n\nHowever, you cannot participate in the Battle Zone again after you've been revived, so be careful!\n\nIf a test subject enters or leaves the Battle Zone, they <color=#8FDBF8>immediately die</color> and cannot be revived.
gameTip_Title_10200_4┃Battle Zone Rewards
gameTip_Desc_10200_4┃The winning team in the Battle Zone can get rewards like special materials or tactical skill upgrade kits in either the HUD or the Security Console.\n\nThe more participants in the Battle Zone, the better the rewards!\n\nBattle Zone rewards can only be purchased <color=#8FDBF8>once per team</color>, so choose wisely!
gameTip_Title_10210_1┃Battle Zone System
gameTip_Desc_10210_1┃The Battle Zone is comprised of the following four systems:\n\nBattle Zone Kit / Battle Zone Mark / Corrosion Gauge / Battle Zone Shuttle\n\nEach system is systematically linked.
gameTip_Title_10210_2┃Battle Zone Kit
gameTip_Desc_10210_2┃When a test subject participates in the Battle Zone owning a Battle Zone Kit, they are given <color=#8FDBF8>Rapid Reconstruction buff</color> and <color=#8FDBF8>Battle Zone Mark</color>.\n\nA test subject with the Rapid Reconstruction buff is revived after a short period of time if they die.\n\nBattle Zone Kit is permanently removed for test subjects who won in the Battle Zone.
gameTip_Title_10210_3┃Battle Zone Mark
gameTip_Desc_10210_3┃The Battle Zone Mark symbolizes the unique environment and gives special effects to participants.\n\nIf a participant dies, the Battle Zone Mark can be recovered and used as currency for the winning team to purchase rewards.\n\nIf there is no winning team, the recovered Battle Zone Marks are permanently removed.
gameTip_Title_10210_4┃Corrosion Gauge
gameTip_Desc_10210_4┃In the Battle Zone, the <color=#8FDBF8>Corrosion Gauge</color> accumulates in return for strengthening test subjects' abilities.\n\nTest subjects who max out their Corrosion Gauge will die after a certain amount of time.\n\nCorrosion Gauge can be recovered by standing within range of a Battle Zone Shuttle or by killing other test subjects.
gameTip_Title_10210_5┃Battle Zone Shuttle
gameTip_Desc_10210_5┃The Battle Zone Shuttle travels a designated route in the Battle Zone, restoring Corrosion Gauge.\n\nIf there are only allies around, Corrosion Gauge will continuously be restored.\n\nFight around the Shuttle!
gameTip_Title_10220_1┃Tactical Skills
gameTip_Desc_10220_1┃Tactical skills are crucial in the game, so it's important to choose and use them wisely based on your team, enemy selection, and your own test subject's style. Have fun strategizing and enjoying a variety of tactical skills!\n\n*You can <color=#8FDBF8>enhance</color> tactical skills by spending Credits. Level 2 upgrades require <color=#8FDBF8>special materials</color>.
gameTip_Title_10230_1┃Operator
gameTip_Desc_10230_1┃Not sure what to do?\n\nJust follow an operator who can guide you.\nThey'll show you the right path for your situation.\n\nYou can turn them on and off in the [Settings], and you can choose the kind of guidance you want in the [Custom Game] presets.
gameTip_Title_10240_1┃Credit Revival
gameTip_Desc_10240_1┃Don't give up just because you're dead!\n\nTeammates can spend a certain amount of credits to revive a dead teammate at Kiosk.\nHowever, you can't choose the respawn point, so it's best to let your teammates know in advance.
gameTip_Title_10250_1┃Campfire
gameTip_Title_10260_1┃V-Pad
gameTip_Desc_10260_1┃Mastery, tactical skills, item management... Too much to think about, right?\nDon't worry, just press V! \n\nWith the new VPad, you'll be able to see all the information you need to progress in the game at a glance.\nVPad is here to save you the trouble!
gameTip_Title_10270_1┃Escape
gameTip_Desc_10270_1┃Another way to end the game is by taking a submarine off Lumia Island in the Escape Area.\n\nIf you successfully escape, you'll earn <color=#8FDBF8>additional Rank Points</color>!
gameTip_Title_10270_2┃Escape Area Entry Conditions
gameTip_Desc_10270_2┃You can only enter the Escape Area using the <color=#8FDBF8>Loop Card Key - Red</color> to call the loop and if the following <color=#8FDBF8>5 conditions</color> are met:\n\n1. 1 or more team members have died\n2. At least 3 teams are still alive\n3. Accessible from Day 4 onwards\n4. No team has successfully escaped\n5. If you have escape items and have agreed to the escape vote
gameTip_Title_10270_3┃Escape Items
gameTip_Desc_10270_3┃You will need a <color=#8FDBF8>Loop Card Key - Red</color> to move to the Escape Area.\n\nThe Loop Card Key - Red can be purchased with credits at Kiosks, and are limited to a <color=#8FDBF8>maximum of 3 teams</color>.
gameTip_Title_10270_4┃Escape Voting
gameTip_Desc_10270_4┃Escape Voting is held prior to moving to the Escape Area.\nIf the team that meets the entry conditions purchases a Loop Card Key - Red from a Kiosk, a vote will be conducted.\n\nThere will be two rounds of voting, each lasting for 30 seconds. You can only move to the Escape Area if the majority votes to escape. Be careful though, if you don't participate, it will be considered a vote in favor!\n\nThe second round of voting can be done after a certain amount of time.
gameTip_Title_10270_5┃How to Escape
gameTip_Desc_10270_5┃You can move to the Escape Area by using the <color=#8FDBF8>Loop Card Key - Red</color> you purchased to summon the Escape Loop.\nInteract with the loop to move into the Escape Area.\n\nOnce there, you can escape using objectives located in the area. \n\nJust a heads up, if there are two teams in the Escape Area, nobody can escape until one team is left.
gameTip_Title_11000_1┃What is Cobalt?
gameTip_Desc_11000_1┃A mode where you can enjoy a combat-oriented 4vs4 battle.\nDeduct the opposing team's life points through battle and capture to secure victory!
gameTip_Title_11000_2┃Test Subject Selection
gameTip_Desc_11000_2┃Select <color=#8FDBF8>your character</color> at the start of the character selection phase.\n\nYour opponents may also have the same characters as you or your allies.\n\nYou cannot use characters that you don't own or that are not in the free rotation.
gameTip_Title_11000_3┃Victory Conditions
gameTip_Desc_11000_3┃The first team to reduce 45 life points from the other team wins!\nLife points can be reduced by:\n\n1. Eliminating an enemy test subject: -1 point\n2. Taking over the Power Beacon for 40 seconds: -1 point\n3, Defeating Gamma: -5 points
gameTip_Title_11000_4┃Phase 4
gameTip_Desc_11000_4┃If a winner isn't decided within the time frame, the <color=#8FDBF8>sudden death phase</color> kicks in to settle the final result.\nEach team's Life Points are reset to 1.
gameTip_Title_11000_5┃Items
gameTip_Desc_11000_5┃At the start of each game, there is an equipment draft with Epic items. \n\nRecommended items based on your character and weapon type are displayed, but you're free to choose others.\n\nYou can purchase items through the Synthesizer (B)'s Extra Equipment Draft.
gameTip_Title_11000_6┃Infusions
gameTip_Desc_11000_6┃In each phase (1, 2, 3), you can select 1 of 3 infusions.\nIf you don’t like the options, you can refresh each infusion once for a different choice.\nOnce you select an infusion, you <color=#8FDBF8>cannot exchange it</color> for another!
gameTip_Title_11000_7┃Synthesizer
gameTip_Desc_11000_7┃You can use it when you're in the Control Room or by pressing the B key upon being eliminated.\n\nYou can cannot use the Synthesizer if you leave your team's base.
gameTip_Title_11000_8┃Omega/Gamma
gameTip_Desc_11000_8┃<color=#8FDBF8>Omega</color> appears in Phase 2 and can grant a large amount of credits when defeated.\n\n<color=#8FDBF8>Gamma</color> appears in Phase 3 and can cut the opponent team's life points when defeated.\n\nThese are very strong monsters, so be careful!
gameTip_Title_11000_9┃Power Beacon
gameTip_Desc_11000_9┃Capture the <color=#8FDBF8>3 Power Beacons</color> located in the center of the map.\nCaptured Power Beacons deduct the opponent team's life points after a certain amount of time.  \nIn Phase 3, all Power Beacons except the central one are deactivated. Life Points will be immediately deducted depending on whether they were captured or not.
gameTip_Title_11000_10┃Credits
gameTip_Desc_11000_10┃You can earn credits through:\n\n1. Capturing Power Beacons\n2. Natural Gain (Periodically throughout the match)\n3. Kills/Assists\n4. Hunting Boss Monsters
gameTip_Title_11000_11┃Cobalt Tactical Skills
gameTip_Desc_11000_11┃You can use special tactical skills that are different from the ones on Lumia Island.\n\nAt the start of each game, after the Epic equipment draft, you can select 1 of 6 tactical skills. \n2 are fixed options and 4 are randomly drafted to you. Pick your favorite one!
gameTip_Title_11000_12┃Additional Supply Boxes
gameTip_Desc_11000_12┃<color=#8FDBF8>Mystery Supply Box items</color> appear in Phase 3.\n\nYou can get very strong equipment from the Control Room's Supply Box in Phase 3 depending on your score difference.
gameTip_Title_10160_2┃Mastery
gameTip_Desc_10160_2┃<color=#8FDBF8>Mastery</color> is divided into Defense, Hunting, Crafting, Movement, Search, and Weapons.\nYou gain Mastery when you meet the requirements for each of the above, and you level up when you accumulate a certain number of Masteries.\nYou can learn more about the requirements on the <color=#8FDBF8>V-Pad</color>.
gameTip_Title_10070_3┃Launch Pad
gameTip_Desc_10070_3┃The Launch Pad allows you to easily and quickly move to distant areas!\nThey can be crucial in confrontations with enemies, so practice using them strategically!
gameTip_Title_10401_1┃Introducing Weather Variables
gameTip_Desc_10401_1┃Lumia Island's weather is influenced by 1 main and 1 sub weather, with different effects being applied based on the corresponding weather conditions.\nYou can check which weather variables you've been assigned through the cinematic intro after matching or in-game.
gameTip_Title_10402_1┃Main Weather
gameTip_Desc_10402_1┃The main weather types are Cloudy, Clear, Rainy and Sandstorm.\n\nCloudy: Lumia Island's default weather with no effects applied.\n\nClear: An optimal environment. This weather facilitates food crafting and visibility.\n\nRainy: Perfect for hiding. The number of brushes in the island is increased and hearing range is reduced.\n\nSandstorm: A very restrictive environment. Test subjects gain tenacity and whirlwinds are created.
gameTip_Title_10402_2┃Main Weather - Clear
gameTip_Desc_10402_2┃Overall there are less brushes around the island and your vision range is increased.\nYour recovery from crafted consumables is also increased.\nYou have higher chances to get Rare Materials from collecting consumables.
gameTip_Title_10402_3┃Main Weather - Rainy
gameTip_Desc_10402_3┃Overall there are more brushes around the island.\nYour hearing range decreases and wild animals' attack power is reduced. 
gameTip_Title_10402_4┃Main Weather - Sandstorm
gameTip_Desc_10402_4┃Test subjects that withstand the harsh sandtorm gain Tenacity.\nA whirlwind is created, making targets hit by it untargetable. Targets caught in the whirlwind are able to move over walls after a certain time. 
gameTip_Title_10403_1┃Sub Weather
gameTip_Desc_10403_1┃The sub weather types are Windless, Foggy, Strong Winds and Lightning.\n\nWindless: Lumia Island's default weather with no effects applied.\n\nFoggy: You have limited information. Air supply box locations are not displayed.\n\nStrong Winds: Perfect for moving faster. Your basic movement speed increases and strong wind zones increase your movement speed in one direction.\n\nLightning: A threatening environment. Lightning strikes occur randomly outdoors, except in restricted areas.
gameTip_Title_10403_2┃Sub Weather - Foggy
gameTip_Desc_10403_2┃Information is limited due to the fog.\nAir supply box locations are not displayed. 
gameTip_Title_10403_3┃Sub Weather - Strong Winds
gameTip_Desc_10403_3┃Your base movement speed is increased.\nStrong Wind zones are created in specific areas, increasing your movement speed in one direction.
gameTip_Title_10403_4┃Sub Weather - Lightning
gameTip_Desc_10403_4┃Lightning strikes happen all around the island except in Restricted Areas.\nThe frequency of lightning strikes increases over the course of the experiment.
gameTip_Title_10404_1┃Introducing Eco Objectives
gameTip_Desc_10404_1┃There are 5 Eco Objectives and each of them apply different effects. These are: Glowing Flower, White Lily, Healing Spray, Sandy Mushroom and Bomb Fruit.
gameTip_Title_10404_2┃Eco Objective - Glowing Flower
gameTip_Desc_10404_2┃The flower emits a fan-shaped wave in the direction of the attack.\nThe fan-shaped wave travels a certain distance, granting vision and making you visible to your enemy test subjects within range for a certain period of time.
gameTip_Title_10404_3┃Eco Objective - White Lily
gameTip_Desc_10404_3┃Test subjects within range are knocked back.\nAirborne test subjects can go over walls.
gameTip_Title_10404_4┃Eco Objective - Healing Spray
gameTip_Desc_10404_4┃When the objective is under attack it sprays a mist that heals tests subjects within a certain range.\nHealing is applied to both allies and enemies.
gameTip_Title_10404_5┃Eco Objective - Sandy Mushroom
gameTip_Desc_10404_5┃This objective releases cloud of sand, granting invisibility within range for a certain period of time.
gameTip_Title_10404_6┃Eco Objective - Bomb Fruit
gameTip_Desc_10404_6┃Fruits are released in a fan shape in the direction of the attack, dealing damage.\nFruit damage does not affect allies and is proportional to max hp.\nThe fruits also deal additional damage to Wild Animals.
gameTip_Title_10501_1┃Gadget Introduction
gameTip_Desc_10501_1┃Gadgets are usable items that provide useful effects during experiments.\nYou can obtain gadgets through various means such as mutant wild animals or air supplies, and each player can only hold one type of gadget.
gameTip_Title_10502_1┃Kiosk Remote
gameTip_Desc_10502_1┃Have you ever been unable to use Credits because the area where the Kiosk was located was occupied?\nNow, with the 'Kiosk Remote' gadget obtained from mutant wild animals, you can summon a Mobile Kiosk drone from any location and use your credits.
gameTip_Title_10503_1┃Flare Guns
gameTip_Desc_10503_1┃These flare guns embody the saying, "A crisis is an opportunity."\nCollect one of the two types of flare guns, Flare Gun B and Flare Gun R, from Epic Air Supply boxes and turn crises into opportunities.
gameTip_Title_10503_2┃Flare Gun B
gameTip_Desc_10503_2┃Using the Flare Gun B allows you to select a specific point within a wide area to call a Mythic Air Supply box.\nThe location is revealed to all test subjects, but it can turn a crisis into an opportunity as you get a chance to acquire powerful mythic items.
gameTip_Title_10503_3┃Flare Gun R
gameTip_Desc_10503_3┃Use the Flare Gun R to become the spawn point of the air supply.\n(Upon death, the supply box will arrive to the location of your corpse)\nAlthough the location is revealed to all test subjects within a certain range, overcoming this crisis can lead to obtaining powerful mythic items.
gameTip_Title_10504_1┃Mobile VLS
gameTip_Desc_10504_1┃The Mobile VLS provides the same functionality as the standard VLS but is a single-use gadget that enables synchronized gliding with allies.\nWhile you're gliding, the ground becomes visible below a certain altitude, making it excellent for scouting.\nLanding after gliding triggers a brief area-wide stun, making it useful for initiating.\nOnly the Host can control the gliding, with allies relying on the Host for synchronized movement. At a certain altitude, allies can break away from the Host and move freely.
gameTip_Title_10511_1┃Guide Robot - Lumi
gameTip_Desc_10511_1┃Lumi is a cute guide robot that roams around Lumia Island, selling special items.\nOnce it accumulates a certain amount of credits, you can steal them from Lumi.
gameTip_Title_10512_1┃Guide Robot - Special Shop
gameTip_Desc_10512_1┃Lumi will stop and greet you when you get close to it during the game. Right-click on it to interact with it and purchase special items not available at Kiosks at a low price. Once you buy an item, the guide robot will dash away at high speed. If you don't purchase anything, it will take a short break, temporarily stop selling items and move around slowly.
gameTip_Title_10513_1┃Guide Robot: Credits Charged
gameTip_Desc_10513_1┃Spend Credits at the Kiosks, with the Guide Robot, or using Remote Drones to help the Guide Robot accumulate enough Credits to enter a "Credits Charged" state.\nApproach the Guide Robot in this state and right-click to channel for a short time. The Guide Robot will then enter a 'Alert Mode', shooting energy projectiles at nearby test subjects as it flees.\nAttack the fleeing Guide Robot and deal enough damage to make it drop Credits on the ground. Collecting these Credits will reward you with an amount of Credits proportional to your character's level.
gameTip_Title_10514_1┃Guide Robot - Detailed Explanation
gameTip_Desc_10514_1┃The Guide Robot's revival function is available until Restricted Areas become active after Day 5. If you lose a teammate during late game, look for the Guide Robot for a turnaround.\nYou can always check the Guide Robot's location on the Expanded Map/Minimap. Since the Guide Robot dislikes Restricted Areas, it moves at five times the normal speed within them.
gameTip_Title_10521_1┃What are Cubes?
gameTip_Desc_10521_1┃Cubes are objectives that grant special effects to the character who collects them, depending on their type.\nThe type of cube is determined one minute before it spawns, and you can obtain it by directly touching the cube once it spawns.
gameTip_Title_10522_1┃Sanguine Cube
gameTip_Desc_10522_1┃The red Sanguine Cube grants the character who collects it a powerful ability to deal continuous damage over time.
gameTip_Title_10523_1┃Galaxy Cube
gameTip_Desc_10523_1┃The purple Galaxy Cube grants the character who collects it reduced cooldowns, an increased max cooldown reduction and a skill amp increase, as well as partial recovery of lost SP periodically and additional damage based on Skill Amplification.
gameTip_Title_10524_1┃Prosperity Cube
gameTip_Desc_10524_1┃The golden Prosperity Cube grants the character who collects it Credits proportional to their level shortly after.
gameTip_Title_10525_1┃Essence Cube
gameTip_Desc_10525_1┃The green Essence Cube grants the character who collects it the ability to recover health proportional to their max HP for a short time when their HP drops below a certain amount and they take damage.
gameTip_Title_10526_1┃Zephyr Cube
gameTip_Desc_10526_1┃The sky-blue Zephyr Cube grants the character who acquires it a burst of movement speed for a short time after collecting it, significantly increasing their movement speed, out-of-combat movement speed and attack speed for the duration of the buff. During combat, movement speed is increased.
gameTip_Title_10621_1┃What is a Secret Lab?
gameTip_Desc_10621_1┃A Secret Lab is a hidden location within Lumia Island where you can obtain special rewards without other teams getting on your way.\nYou can only enter the lab using the Mobile Loop that is activated with a Loop Key Card and you can return to Lumia Island using the Loop inside the lab.
gameTip_Title_10622_1┃Loop Card Keys
gameTip_Desc_10622_1┃The Loop Key Cards are a new gadget that grant access to the Secret Lab. These can be obtained from Ravens.\nOccasionally, a large raven may appear, dropping a special blue Loop Key Card.
gameTip_Title_10623_1┃Mobile Loop
gameTip_Desc_10623_1┃Use the Loop Key Card to activate a portable loop that grants access to a Secret Lab.\n\nThe portable loop can only be accessed at designated times during the game, and you can only access one Secret Lab per game.\n\nIf all labs are full, you've already visited a lab, or the entry time has passed, the loop turns red and deactivates.
gameTip_Title_10624_1┃About the Secret Lab
gameTip_Desc_10624_1┃Once you arrive at a Secret Lab, activate the door console to earn credits and open the door. \n\nExplore the entire lab, hunt wild animals, open boxes, and more. When the timer at the top ends, the lab becomes a Restricted Area. \nMake sure to exit the lab using the loop before you run out of time.
gameTip_Title_10625_1┃Types of Secret Labs
gameTip_Desc_10625_1┃There are different types of Secret Labs, each with their own searching methods and rewards. You might even come across a special lab.
gameTip_Title_10050_3┃Box Group Display
gameTip_Desc_10050_3┃Displays in blue the boxes closest to the starting point for each area.\nBy opening all the boxes in the same group, you can get at least all the target items for that area.\nThis is important information when deciding your Early-game route, so check the boxes with the <color=#8FDBF8>box group indicator</color> first!

InGameGuide/Nadja/Group/Name/10274000┃Mutants Lab

InGameGuide/Nadja/Group/Name/10274100┃Mutants Lab

Tutorial/Title/4┃Power Up
Tutorial/Title/5┃Mastery
Tutorial/Desc/1┃Welcome to Lumia Island.\n\nJackie will teach you the basics of item searching in order to survive on this island.\n\nTo think you'll learn from a Serial Killer! You're in good hands, right?
Tutorial/Desc/2┃Learn about skills and fighting with the Axe weapon. The axe is good to learn with because it's stronger than other weapons in the beginning of the match.\n\nFind enemies and kill them. The axe will become weaker as the game progresses.
Tutorial/Desc/3┃You can become stronger by killing wild animals.\n\nYou'll play as Aya. She might seem careless, but she's still a police officer handling a gun.
Tutorial/Desc/4┃Try exploring Lumia Island a bit more.\n\nJackie is an intelligent murderer. Try efficiently finding materials so you can craft several targeted items at the same time.
Tutorial/Desc/5┃Your weapon and defense masteries increase as you fight.\n\nMoving around increases your movement mastery and making equipment increases your crafting mastery.\n\nAya might seem like a weak rookie with a puny sniper rifle,\nbut you'll change your mind once she lands a shot on you after increasing her sniper rifle mastery.

Tutorial/Announce_Tutorial_11┃Your character just leveled up!\nEvery time you level up, you can upgrade one of your skills.
Tutorial/Announce_Tutorial_12┃Staying in a restricted area ticks down your rolling timer.\nWhen the 30 seconds of the timer are up... you explode.\nHurry and move to a safe zone.
Tutorial/Announce_Tutorial_13┃Each area in Lumia Island contains different materials.\nUse the guides on the right side of the screen to help you gather materials.
Tutorial/Announce_Tutorial_14┃Go to another area to collect the rest of the materials you need for your other items.\nSince you've got a weapon, if you see someone else, try and fight them
Tutorial/Announce_Tutorial_15┃Raise your weapon mastery through fighting and hunting. \nOnce your weapon mastery is high enough, you can activate your weapon skill with [D].\n

Tutorial/Announce/초급2/이미지가이드1/제목┃Air Supply Box
Tutorial/Announce/초급2/이미지가이드1/내용┃Air Supply Boxes sometimes fall around Lumia Island.\nAir Supply Boxes contain <color=#93c9e7>equipment or consumables</color> that are the same rarity as the box.\n\nThe place where Air Supply Boxes drop is <color=#93c9e7>displayed with a Box Mark for a short amount of time before it falls</color>, so consult your map and go get it!\n\nYou <color=#C57BEF>can collect special materials</color> such as Meteorite, Tree of Life, Mythril and Force Core in <color=#C57BEF>Epic Air Supply Boxes</color>\nGet those materials and craft powerful items!
Tutorial/Announce/초급2/이미지가이드2/제목┃Security Console Monitor
Tutorial/Announce/초급2/이미지가이드2/내용┃Security Consoles can be found all around Lumia Island. If you hack into them, <color=#93c9e7>you can find out what's going on around the island through the CCTV.</color>\nYou can also check the amount of materials remaining in that area.

Tutorial/Announce/초급3/이미지가이드1/제목┃Mastery
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/이미지가이드1/내용1┃Everything a test subject does increases their Mastery.\nFor example, combining items increases Crafting Mastery, and opening item boxes increases Search Mastery.\n\nBy raising Mastery, test subject levels will increase and their skills will grow stronger.
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/이미지가이드1/내용2┃Out of all the available Masteries, the most important is <color=#93c9e7>Weapon Mastery.</color> By raising Weapon Mastery, <color=#93c9e7>Attack Power and Attack Speed also increase.</color> At Weapon Mastery levels <color=#93c9e7>5, 10 and 15, you can increase Weapon Skills by 1 Level each</color>.\nYou can raise Weapon Mastery by crafting Weapons, <color=#93c9e7>attacking other test subjects, or hunting Wild Animals.</color>
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/VPAD가이드1/제목┃Mastery
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/VPAD가이드1/내용┃· Everything a test subject does increases their Mastery.\n· By raising Mastery, test subject levels will increase and their skills will grow stronger.\n·  At Weapon Mastery levels <color=#93c9e7>5, 10 and 15, you can increase Weapon Skills by 1 level each</color>.\n· You can raise Weapon Mastery by <color=#8FDBF8>crafting Weapons</color>, <color=#8FDBF8>attacking other test subjects</color>, or <color=#8FDBF8>hunting Wild Animals</color>.
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/VPAD가이드2/제목┃Tactical Skills
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/VPAD가이드2/내용┃· You can enhance Tactical Skills by <color=#8FDBF8>spending Credits</color>.\n· <color=#8FDBF8>Level 2 upgrade</color> requires a <color=#8FDBF8>Tac. Skil Module</color>.\n· You can purchase a <color=#8FDBF8>Tac. Skill Module</color> with <color=#8FDBF8>Credits at Kiosks</color>.
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/VPAD가이드3/제목┃Target Items
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/VPAD가이드3/내용┃· You can see a <color=#8FDBF8>list of the material items</color> registered in the Saved Plan.\n· When you <color=#8FDBF8>Left-click the target item</color>, you'll see the <color=#8FDBF8>Item crafting tree</color>.\n· You can <color=#8FDBF8>right-click on the sub-material item</color> to <color=#8FDBF8>to spend Credits and instantly acquire it</color> in the Item crafting tree.
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/이미지가이드2/제목┃Meteorite and Tree of Life
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/이미지가이드2/내용┃Meteorites and Tree of Life are very rare materials used to craft <color=#93c9e7>Legendary Items</color>.\n\nBoth items spawn and can be found in certain locations at specific times.\n\n<color=#93c9e7>You can check when and where both items will spawn by pressing the Tab key and checking the window to the left.</color>\n\n(You can check even if the Map (M key) is open.)
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/이미지가이드3/제목┃Credits
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/이미지가이드3/내용1┃You can easily purchase needed ingredients by using Credits.\n\n<color=#93c9e7>Right-click the materials you want in the Target Item Window on the top right of the screen</color>, then use your credits to get the item you need.
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/이미지가이드3/내용2┃Items that can be obtained with Credits are displayed in yellow in the upper righthand corner of the screen.
Tutorial/Announce/초급3/이미지가이드3/내용3┃You get Credits by slaying Wild Animals. <color=#93c9e7>Slaying Mutant Wild Animals will make you especially rich!</color>\n\nYou can check how many Credits you have in the bottom center of the screen.

Tutorial/Cutscene/초급2/쇼이치6┃See, you should've hid better.
Tutorial/Cutscene/초급2/혜진7┃What's going on?
Tutorial/Cutscene/초급2/쇼이치8┃No more emotions.
Tutorial/Cutscene/초급3/니키1┃Eva!
Tutorial/Cutscene/초급3/니키2┃No!
Tutorial/Cutscene/초급3/이바3┃Nicky!!
Tutorial/Cutscene/초급3/안내방송4┃A new Restricted Area has been designated.
Tutorial/Victory/1┃How does it feel to get revenge?
Tutorial/Victory/2┃There's no such thing as a set fate.
Tutorial/Victory/3┃Looks like you're ready. Good job.
GuideBook/MainTheme/Title/PREFACE┃Preface
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/EternalReturn┃Eternal Return
GuideBook/Page/Content/EternalReturn/1┃Eternal Return is a <color=white>Battle Royale</color> game, where test subjects compete to become the final survivor.
GuideBook/Page/Content/EternalReturn/2┃This guide will take you through the most basic tips you need to know to master the game from start to end.
GuideBook/MainTheme/Title/GROWTH┃Opening
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/EpicReady┃Craft
GuideBook/Page/Content/EpicReady/1┃<color=white>(1/3)</color>\n\nUpon arrival, your first assignment is to craft <color=yellow>starting target items</color> in your Saved Plan.\n\nFrom your spawn point, you will notice <color=yellow>boxes</color> that are highlighted in blue. Boxes hold items that are distinct to the area you are in.\n\nLook out for the items marked with a <color=yellow>yellow triangle</color>. These are the items you need to craft the equipment in your Saved Plan.
GuideBook/Page/Content/EpicReadyTwo/1┃<color=white>(2/3)</color>\n\nYou can also acquire items by <color=white>hunting wild animals, collecting natural resources, and calling remote drones</color>.\n\nPress Z to combine these materials until you craft all the <color=white>target items in your Saved Plan</color>.
GuideBook/Page/Content/EpicReadyThree/1┃<color=white>(3/3)</color>\n\nYou can check your starting target items on the <color=white>upper right corner</color>. Once you've finished crafting your your starting target items, they will automatically be updated into your late game equipments.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/TeamUp┃Team Up
GuideBook/Page/Content/TeamUp/1┃Once you've crafted all the target equipment in your Saved Plan, you can use the <color=yellow>Hyperloop</color> to join your teammates.
GuideBook/Page/Content/TeamUp/2┃Click on your <color=white>teammate's portrait</color> on the upper right corner of the Hyperloop UI to teleport to their location.
GuideBook/Page/Content/TeamUp/3┃During early game, up until <color=yellow>Night 2</color>, you and your teammates can revive after a brief waiting time.\nYou can select the location where you'd like to revive, including your teammate's location by clicking on their portrait.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/Hunt┃Hunt
GuideBook/Page/Content/Hunt/1┃Start hunting <color=yellow>wild animals</color> with your teammates.\nUse the security console in each area to track their locations, which will be displayed on your <color=white>Minimap</color>.
GuideBook/Page/Content/Hunt/2┃Hunt wild animals to get <color=yellow>Credits</color> and gain <color=yellow>Mastery</color>. \n<color=yellow>Credits</color> are a valuable resource in Lumia Island that can be used to buy special materials or revive your teammates.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/FindFood┃Food
GuideBook/Page/Content/FindFood/1┃You can recover HP by consuming <color=yellow>Food</color>.\nThis effect will <color=white>persist even in battle</color>, so be sure to stack them in your inventory.
GuideBook/Page/Content/FindFood/2┃You can obtain raw ingredients from <color=white>wild animals, boxes, or by collecting them in the wild</color>.\nWhile you can consume them to recover HP, they are not very effective.\n\nFind a <color=yellow>Campfire</color> to cook these raw ingredients into more effective food.\n\nYou can also find moderately effective food in <color=yellow>Food Air Supply Boxes</color>.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/TreeOfLife┃Tree of Life / Meteorite
GuideBook/Page/Content/TreeOfLife/1┃<color=yellow>On Day 2</color>, two special meterials will spawn on Lumia Island: <color=yellow>Tree of Life</color> and <color=yellow>Meteorite</color>.\n\n<color=yellow>Tree of Life</color> has a fixed spawn point, while <color=yellow>Meteorite</color> collisions will happen at random locations on the island each game.
GuideBook/Page/Content/TreeOfLife/2┃<color=yellow>Special Materials</color> are <color=white>highly valued rare resources</color> in Lumia Island. This means that you must be ready to <color=white>engage in combat</color> with other teams to acquire these materials.\n\nTry not to lose!
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/UpgradeItems┃Equipment Upgrade
GuideBook/Page/Content/UpgradeItems/1┃You need <color=yellow>Special Materials</color> to craft <color=yellow>Legendary items</color>.
GuideBook/Page/Content/UpgradeItems/2┃Each teammate may need different <color=yellow>special materials</color>, so be sure to distribute them strategically.
GuideBook/MainTheme/Title/EXPLORATION┃Middlegame
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/UpgradeItemsTwo┃Special Materials
GuideBook/Page/Content/UpgradeItemsTwo/1┃<color=white>(1/2)</color>\n\nYou can obtain the special materials needed to craft your late-game equipment from the island's main objectives, like <color=white>Tree of Life, Meteorite, Alpha/Omega and Air Supplies</color>
GuideBook/Page/Content/UpgradeItemsTwo/2┃You can also purchase them from <color=yellow>Kiosks</color> that you can find in different areas across the island.
GuideBook/Page/Content/UpgradeItemsThree/1┃<color=white>(2/2)</color>\n\n<color=yellow>Main objectives</color> are usually displayed on your <color=white>Minimap</color>. \nYou can also check their spawn times on the Scoreboard by pressing the <color=white>Tab Key</color>.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/RestrictedArea┃Restricted Areas
GuideBook/Page/Content/RestrictedArea/1┃Each Day and Night, a random area on the island will become a <color=red>Restricted Area</color>, marked in <color=red>red</color> on your Expanded Map. Upcoming Restricted Areas are marked in <color=yellow>orange</color> before they're designated as such.
GuideBook/Page/Content/RestrictedArea/2┃Every second spent at a Restricted Area will consume your <color=red>restriction timer</color>. Once you run out of time, you are instantly <color=red>eliminated</color>.
GuideBook/Page/Content/RestrictedArea/3┃However, don’t hesitate to use your restriction timer during a <color=white>tough situation</color>. Sometimes, <color=white>escaping into a Restricted Area</color> can be the smart choice for survival. After all, you can restore your timer by <color=white>eliminating enemy characters</color>.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/Transport┃Transportation
GuideBook/Page/Content/Transport/1┃There are various means of transportation on Lumia Island.\n\n<color=yellow>Hyperloops</color> take you to any area you choose or directly to your teammate’s location.\n<color=yellow>White Lily</color> lets you jump a short distance across walls.\n<color=yellow>Launch Pads</color> help you jump <color=white>longer distances</color> over obstacles.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/Vision┃Secure Vision
GuideBook/Page/Content/Vision/1┃Always keep an eye out! <color=yellow>Vision</color> helps you make smarter battle decisions, and you and your teammates should always be aware of your surroundings.\n\n<color=yellow>Security Consoles</color> reveal the surrounding area when activated.\n<color=yellow>Glowing Flowers</color> detonate to briefly grant vision in the opposite direction.\n<color=yellow>Telephoto Cameras and Drones</color> can be installed from your inventory to provide vision of their surroundings, so be sure to install them in strategic locations.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/TeamFight┃Team Fight
GuideBook/Page/Content/TeamFight/1┃Using your character's <color=white>Skills, Tactical Skills and Weapon Skills</color> efficiently is the key to winning team fights.
GuideBook/Page/Content/TeamFight/2┃<color=white>Starting on Day 2</color>, if <color=yellow>you and your teammates</color> are all downed or eliminated, your experiment will be <color=red>terminated</color>.\nIf the enemy team is <color=red>too strong</color>, always consider <color=white>retreating</color> and waiting for a better opportunity.
GuideBook/Page/Content/TeamFight/3┃When a character's HP reaches zero, they enter a <color=yellow>Downed State</color>.\nRight-click on a <color=white>downed ally</color> to revive them.\nEliminate a <color=white>downed enemy</color> to recover some HP and loot their Credits, Consumables, and Food.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/Resurrection┃Revival
GuideBook/Page/Content/Resurrection/1┃Starting from <color=yellow>Day 3</color>, you can use <color=white>Credits</color> at a <color=yellow>Kiosk</color> to revive eliminated allies.\nIf you don’t have enough Credits, the revived test subject's Credits will be used automatically.
GuideBook/Page/Content/Resurrection/2┃Starting from <color=yellow>Day 5</color>, <color=white>you can no longer revive allies at the Kiosk.</color>
GuideBook/MainTheme/Title/FINALBATTLE┃Endgame
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/BattleReady┃Preparation
GuideBook/Page/Content/BattleReady/1┃<color=yellow>Dr. Wickeline</color> spawns once the end of the match is approaching.\n<color=white>Eliminating</color> her grants you and your teammates a <color=yellow>powerful buff</color>. She also drops <color=yellow>VF Blood Sample</color>, a special material you can use to craft Mythic items.
GuideBook/Page/Content/BattleReady/2┃You can craft Mythic items using <color=yellow>VF Blood Sample</color> or you can collect them from <color=yellow>Mythic Air Supplies</color>.\nYou can also purchase a <color=yellow>VF Blood Sample</color> from a <color=yellow>Kiosk</color> using your Credits.
GuideBook/Page/Content/BattleReady/3┃Prepare for the endgame by stocking up on <color=white>food and cameras.</color>\nNote: You can also purchase these items through the <color=yellow>V Pad</color><color=white> (Hotkey V)</color>.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/TemporarySafeZone┃Temporary Safe Zones
GuideBook/Page/Content/TemporarySafeZone/1┃<color=yellow>Temporary Safe Zones</color> serve as battlegrounds leading up to the final showdown.\nWhen only three safe areas remain, <color=yellow>the two non-adjacent areas</color> will become temporary safe zones.
GuideBook/Page/Content/TemporarySafeZone/2┃Only <color=yellow>one team</color> can survive in each temporary safe zone.\nChoose the <color=white>most advantageous battlefield</color> for your team and move accordingly.
GuideBook/Page/Content/TemporarySafeZone/3┃All <color=yellow>dead or downed teammates</color> of the team that survive the temporary safe zone will be brought back into the experiment.
GuideBook/SubTheme/Title/LastSafeZone┃Final Safe Zone
GuideBook/Page/Content/LastSafeZone/1┃Only the <color=yellow>final battle</color> remains to determine the ultimate winner.\nThe <color=yellow>final safe zone</color> will be designated in the area bridging the two temporary safe zones.\nMake haste to the final safe zone before the other team arrives.
GuideBook/Page/Content/LastSafeZone/2┃Secure your final victory and claim everything.\n<color=white>Let there be glory to the pawns who reached the end of despair!</color>
CharacterStoryName┃Name
CharacterStoryAge┃Age
CharacterStoryHeight┃Height
CharacterStoryGender┃Gender
CharacterStoryName/1┃Jackie Quilt
CharacterStoryAge/1┃22 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/1┃167 cm
CharacterStoryGender/1┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/1┃More...more...more!!
CharacterStoryDesc/1┃Jackie first discovered the thrill of murder after killing both the wife and daughter of a prominent political family, the Winslairs. She went on to become a serial killer with a bodycount of over 30 people.\nHer name 'Quilt' comes from her modus operandi of slicing the victims' bodies into small indistinguishable pieces. The resulting pieces are too small to identify, unless stitched together like a quilt.\nShe gained infamy for her rather inhumane killing methods and meticulous clean-up.\n\nThe body of Jackie's first victim, Angela Winslair, was never found.
CharacterStoryName/2┃Suzuki Aya
CharacterStoryAge/2┃26 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/2┃161 cm
CharacterStoryGender/2┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/2┃For my light, for my justice.
CharacterStoryDesc/2┃Aya was born with an innate longing for justice, and employed this longing to become a police officer. However, her world and confidence in her job was shaken after her family were victims of a murder case. She became obsessed with her vision of justice, beginning to think that only she was able to bring justice to the world.\n\nAya grew repulsed at the sight of corpses. When her job requires the occasional inspection of an animal corpse, it takes a toll on her psyche.\nShe has a brother named Suzuki Hikaru, who lost both of his legs.
CharacterStoryName/3┃Fiora Pellerin
CharacterStoryAge/3┃24 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/3┃158 cm
CharacterStoryGender/3┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/3┃Waist! Neck! Your posture is a mess!
CharacterStoryDesc/3┃Fiora is a renowned fencer. Growing up, her family heavily instilled a belief that she should always have pride and a straight posture.\nHer father never recognized her talent, believing women to be only for doing chores. As an act of rebellion against her father, and with a desire to be recognized by him, Fiora took up fencing.\n\nShe excelled at math in school.\nFiora vows to protect anyone weaker than her, and longs for recognition by anyone stronger than her.
CharacterStoryName/4┃Magnus Scott
CharacterStoryAge/4┃34 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/4┃192 cm
CharacterStoryGender/4┃Male
CharacterStoryTitle/4┃The Legendary Biker, Magnus!
CharacterStoryDesc/4┃Leader of the radical biker group Reaper's Wheel.\nA man who has risen through the ranks of the organization from member to leader by force alone.\n\nMagnus kept the organization alive for his own strength and muscle rather than loyalty and friendship.\nMany members do not like him because he tries to solve everything through force.\n\nHe despises the weak, especially those who move from place to place like bats.\nA man remembered more for his brute force and power than for the backlight of his bike.
CharacterStoryName/5┃Zahir Singh
CharacterStoryAge/5┃18 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/5┃175 cm
CharacterStoryGender/5┃Male
CharacterStoryTitle/5┃I behold the vision of the Almighty.
CharacterStoryDesc/5┃Zahir claims to see God with his own eyes. But the truth will forever remain unanswered, shrouded in uncertainty.\n\nHe escaped from an orphanage at a young age and wandered aimlessly, hungry and desperate. Fate led him to a humble temple, where he found refuge and, miraculously survived.\n\nHe became a devoted follower, believing that his God had mercifully saved him. His morning ritual is to shower and brush his hair with a wooden comb. \n\nHe doesn't talk much, so it's not very noticeable, but he has a knack for saying slightly "edgy" things. \n\n
CharacterStoryName/6┃Nadine Chandrawinata
CharacterStoryAge/6┃21 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/6┃178 cm
CharacterStoryGender/6┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/6┃With a bow in my hands, I won't miss.
CharacterStoryDesc/6┃A feral human who lost her parents in a landslide as a child and grew up among the beasts. Nadine was later returned to human society after being discovered by a hunter. \n\nStill has wild habits and does not adapt well to human society. She doesn't know how to react to small things as humans do, and gets very confused. \nTo hide this, she usually acts bluntly, and would rather be shunned than ignored.\n\nNadine is claustrophobic due to a childhood memory of being buried in a landslide.\nFor some reason, She's been having a lot of dreams lately about being trapped in a cage. What does this dream mean?
CharacterStoryName/7┃Hyunwoo Jang
CharacterStoryAge/7┃17 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/7┃174 cm
CharacterStoryGender/7┃Male
CharacterStoryTitle/7┃It couldn't get any worse.
CharacterStoryDesc/7┃For Hyunwoo, the future was a blur. \n\nRumors, gossip, finger-pointing, stigma... So many things stood in his way. \n\nHe focused on increasing the stimulation of the real world, such as fighting and riding his bike, to take his mind off of it, but no matter how hard he tried to ignore it, the constant anxiety would not go away.\n\nThe first thing he want to do as an adult is buy a lottery ticket. \n\nIf he could just escape his current reality, it would be enough.
CharacterStoryName/8┃Hart Floyd
CharacterStoryAge/8┃23 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/8┃175 cm
CharacterStoryGender/8┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/8┃Love and ...Peace
CharacterStoryDesc/8┃Hart, young and passionate, believed in the power of love and music to transform the world. She picked up the guitar and let the melodies guide her soul.\n\nShe formed a band that gained popularity and caught the interest of major labels. But there was a catch. These labels wanted to control her creativity, preventing her from playing the music that truly touched her soul. But her bandmates, tempted by the money, signed the contract without her. Hart was shocked and determined to prove her beliefs. \n\nLiving in New York City with her twin brother, Clever, Hart suddenly disappeared after sending him a mysterious message about finding a place where her music was desperately needed, leaving Clever puzzled and wondering about her whereabouts.
CharacterStoryName/9┃Isol (Marcelo)
CharacterStoryAge/9┃16 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/9┃167 cm
CharacterStoryGender/9┃Male
CharacterStoryTitle/9┃I can't stop here.
CharacterStoryDesc/9┃Former child soldier in a terrorist organization.\nHe lived in an orphanage under the name Marcelo until the age of 12.\n\nAt the urging of his trusted older brother, he convinced several other children to leave the orphanage and join the terrorist group.\nOf all the children he joined, he was the only one not killed or captured. \n\nTends to kill people more brutally than necessary.\nWhen killing people, he unconsciously recites chants he learned when he was in a choir.
CharacterStoryName/10┃Li Dailin
CharacterStoryAge/10┃26 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/10┃165 cm
CharacterStoryGender/10┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/10┃Would you please stay out of my life?
CharacterStoryDesc/10┃Li Dailin was the only daughter of a martial arts family. Her family chose for her to walk the path of mastery and training, disregarding real parental care for her. This life resulted in nothing but resentment towards martial arts.\nTo enact her revenge, she sold the inherited martial arts studio, along with the secrets that were passed down for generations, and abandoned her "pride" as a martial artist.\n\nWhen she runs out of money for alcohol, she usually picks up odd jobs.\nShe has a reputation as 'Beggar Li' in her hometown.
CharacterStoryName/11┃Sato Yuki
CharacterStoryAge/11┃18 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/11┃171 cm
CharacterStoryGender/11┃Male
CharacterStoryTitle/11┃Is there anything I can do for you?
CharacterStoryDesc/11┃A high school student from an old and prestigious family. He is the vice president of the kendo club at his school.\nDue to his strict upbringing, he is well-mannered and polite in the way he speaks and behaves.\nHe is called honor student, elite, etc. by others, but he has quite a modest attitude.\n\nHe takes each moment calmly and solves problems without panic.\nOnly once, however, did he lose his composure and become agitated when he learned of the death of a close friend.\n\nHe has noble hobbies for his age, such as origami and chess.\nHe just can't seem to think of taking up another hobby.
CharacterStoryName/12┃Hyejin Lee
CharacterStoryAge/12┃18 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/12┃163cm
CharacterStoryGender/12┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/12┃This must be another fated way.
CharacterStoryDesc/12┃The only daughter of a famous hereditary dancer.\nShe was born with the bad luck to follow her until her big break at the age of 18.\n\nDue to her family environment, she has a fatalistic mindset and seems to accept this as her destiny.\nSurprisingly, she has the will to do her best in everything she does.\n\nHer favorite novel is Kim Dong-ri's "Yukma", which is also about destiny.\nSometimes she talks to spirits by playing the pipa... but to others, it's just her talking to herself.
CharacterStoryName/13┃Zuo XiuKai
CharacterStoryAge/13┃34 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/13┃187cm
CharacterStoryGender/13┃Male
CharacterStoryTitle/13┃Stop gazing, or I will fill that dumpling with you.
CharacterStoryDesc/13┃A chef who runs a small restaurant in a small town.\nXiukai was once a renowned chef, and delighted wealthy guests with his exceptional culinary skills. \n\nWith fame, fortune, and influential connections, life seemed perfect. However, circumstances took a turn, forcing him to flee to a foreign land where he now leads a meager life. \n\nHis high prices and sensitive personality, made his popularity went down, and now with little to no clients, he spends his days locked in the kitchen creating very unusual dishes.\n\nHe used to be a lean, mean-looking guy, or so he claims.
CharacterStoryName/14┃Chiara
CharacterStoryAge/14┃21 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/14┃167 cm
CharacterStoryGender/14┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/14┃I'm ruined...There will be no salvation for me...
CharacterStoryDesc/14┃Chiara, abandoned in a secluded Chapel at birth, was raised with tales of God's power. \n\nShe learned that difficult challenges were special gifts from God, testing her faith and a way to repay His love. But her faith was shattered when she came face to face with the vices of a heartless world, and her soul was broken. From then on, Kiara became obsessed with punishment and redemption.\n\nInterestingly, her name means "Brightness," reflecting a different side of her. When she was discovered as a baby, she was found with a radiant smile, giving hope to those who found her.
CharacterStoryName/15┃Sissela Kyle
CharacterStoryAge/15┃16 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/15┃153 cm
CharacterStoryGender/15┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/15┃Life is an agony. Only more agony awaits to greet me.
CharacterStoryDesc/15┃One of only a hundred people in the world with an incurable disease.\nShe was diagnosed at a very young age and has been in the hospital ever since.\n\nShe lived in extreme pain all the time, and although she tried to escape, she couldn't die easily.\nHer case is so rare that the medical community has given her full support.\nBut Sissela feels like a lab rat as they continue to experiment on her.\n\nShe has no friends because she has been in the hospital since she was a child, so she talks to herself by naming the facial expressions she draws.\nHer only friend, Wilson, a living doodle, seems to be the fulfillment of Sissela's desperate wish.
CharacterStoryName/16┃Silvia Piquet

CharacterStoryHeight/16┃166 cm
CharacterStoryGender/16┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/16┃Whoa, that looks fun!
CharacterStoryDesc/16┃Silvia was raised by her grandfather - her parents were never really around. Her mother is a wandering photographer and there is nothing known about her father. She doesn't value making or maintaining relationships - her focus is on living in the now.\nOne of the biggest motives for her becoming a motorcycle racer was the thrill of the race.\n\nSilvia excites easily and acts emotionally without thinking ahead.\nShe gained fame among motorcycle racing circuits for riding dangerously and recklessly, paying no mind to the consequences.
CharacterStoryName/17┃Adriana Rivera
CharacterStoryAge/17┃22 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/17┃169 cm
CharacterStoryGender/17┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/17┃It's kinda chilly... Where'd I put that match?
CharacterStoryDesc/17┃A pyromaniac who terrorized all of Mexico. People called her Firefly because she instinctively set fires wherever she went.\n\nAlways carried a pipe that would not go out. Not because she likes to smoke, but because she always wants to feel the warmth of a live ember. For her, it doesn't matter what the object of arson is. It only matters how warmly it burns.\n\nShe often looks at the flames and whispers softly to herself. As if she's longing for someone she hasn't yet been able to let go of.
CharacterStoryName/18┃Azuma Shoichi

CharacterStoryHeight/18┃179 cm
CharacterStoryGender/18┃Male
CharacterStoryTitle/18┃So, how much is this job worth?
CharacterStoryDesc/18┃He was an ordinary office worker, but losing his wife to illness changed his life.\n\nUnable to afford proper surgery and treatment, he came to believe that she died due to lack of money.\nWhen his daughter began to suffer from the same illness as his wife, Shoichi decided to do whatever it took to gain more money. Even if it meant getting blood on his hands.\n\nShoichi is a very snobbish talker with an unassuming face.\nPrefers tea, but drinks coffee when in the company of others.
CharacterStoryName/19┃Emma Hardy
CharacterStoryAge/19┃21 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/19┃164 cm
CharacterStoryGender/19┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/19┃I'll show you something completely new!
CharacterStoryDesc/19┃Emma is but a cheerful magician with her venue of choice being the sprawling city streets.\n\nWhether it be with her hat, coins, or doves, she's well practiced in all forms of magic; but card tricks are her specialty.\n\nShe was granted the nickname 'Begi Emma' by her early fans, after being a seemingly perpetual beginner. Despite her intimidatingly loud voice (and laugh), she is still approachable and friendly.\n\nTo free herself from her parents' unyielding household, Emma began to seriously pursue her dream as soon as she became an adult. There are whispers amongst the magician community that she wants to become famous to reconnect with her long lost grandfather.
CharacterStoryName/20┃Lenox
CharacterStoryAge/20┃26 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/20┃170 cm
CharacterStoryGender/20┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/20┃Don't you love fishing? It calms your mind.
CharacterStoryDesc/20┃You'll be hard-pressed to find Lenox wearing waders - she's always dressed to the nines. Judging by her disposition, she was once clearly involved in something... organized.\n\nShe's now trying to stay low-key, believing a fishing rod to be good enough a disguise as any, although her colorful and impressive tattoos aren't helping.\n\nLenox can often be found with a smile on her face, but when you ask her about the scar on her back, her whole demeanor changes.
CharacterStoryName/21┃Rozzi
CharacterStoryAge/21┃20 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/21┃165 cm
CharacterStoryGender/21┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/21┃You've done well.
CharacterStoryDesc/21┃A mercenary from a militant organization trained since childhood.\nA member of a mercenary organization called Corda D'arco, Rozzi is the leader of a team dedicated to espionage operations for intelligence agencies and multinational corporations.\n\nShe has a reputation for never losing her cool, and for her commanding ability to find and direct the best tactics in the heat of the moment. \nShe's difficult to get along with because of her expressionless face and dull personality, and she doesn't form close relationships.\n\nFor some reason, she is looking for a former member of her organization. As soon as she heard that he was on Lumia Island, she immediately joined the experiment.\n\nLoves chocolate. She says she takes it for tactical reasons, but we think she just likes chocolate.
CharacterStoryName/22┃Luke (Łuk)
CharacterStoryAge/22┃27 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/22┃177 cm
CharacterStoryGender/22┃Male
CharacterStoryTitle/22┃Double L Cleaning is on the job!
CharacterStoryDesc/22┃A self-proclaimed eight-year veteran janitor. Luke works for a cleaning company called Double L.\n\nHe can show up in any town and blend right in. He's popular for his easy-going personality, smiling face, and ability to do any job, not just cleaning.\n\nBut the "janitor" is just an undercover job. His real identity is a contract killer, and at night he goes out to take out his targets. He hasn't failed a mission yet.\n\nHe grew up in an institution and was adopted by his father, from whom he learned the art of killing, and is currently searching for his whereabouts.\n\nHe cleans up after himself out of habit, even when he's not asked to.
CharacterStoryName/23┃Cathy Huggins
CharacterStoryAge/23┃32 years old
CharacterStoryHeight/23┃169 cm
CharacterStoryGender/23┃Female
CharacterStoryTitle/23┃I've grown used to blood and corpses.
CharacterStoryDesc/23┃Cathy is often kind and sentimental doctor - perhaps a little too much so. Sentimental and good-natured, she gets involved in her patients' affairs more than necessary. Because of this, she was kicked out of her last hospital for causing problems.\n\nShe opened up her very own free medical clinic, supported by the locals just enough for her to get by. A single curious touch turned her life into a nightmare.\n\nThe 'voice' in the dagger quickly destroyed her. \nFirst it took over her dreams, then it controlled her hands, and now it's trying to take over her tongue and her body. \nShe's tried everything to get rid of it, but nothing works.\nThe voice only grew louder and louder.\n\nWhen Ly Anh finally realized that she couldn't escape the voice, she chose to become its prison. She locked herself in a place where no one could find her and from where she could not escape, awaiting death along with the voice in her head.

She doesn't get into trouble with the other test subjects, but it's not because she's mild-mannered, it's because she doesn't feel attached to reality.\n\nWhen Vanya stares into thin air, and butterflies flock to her, it indicates that she is seeing a fantasy.

CharacterStoryTitle/77┃"Let’s catch the wind and see where it takes us!"
CharacterStoryDesc/77┃A young man who roams the world, calling himself a Taoist.\nHe occasionally helps those in trouble and, in return, is offered food and shelter.\n\nAfter losing his parents, he was raised by his grandfather, who lived in seclusion in a remote mountain village, practicing the Tao.\nWhen he was younger, Yumin used his abilities to help people, but all he received in return were cold stares. He swore never to use his powers again.\n\nOne day, a massive typhoon struck the village. Due to his past trauma, Yumin was paralyzed and unable to act.\nThe violent storm took away someone dear to him, almost mocking his inaction, and Yumin fell into despair, blaming himself.\nLost and tormented, he read his grandfather’s final letter and made a resolution:\nHe would find the true meaning of the Tao.\n\nSince then, Yumin has embarked on a journey to seek the Tao.\nLike the clear wind blowing in his heart, he travels freely on his journey.
